properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
One Day International Cricket: Australia v West Indies at the SCG on Sunday 4 February. Start of play at 2:30pm, end of play around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Parks. Fans traveling to and from the match should allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from midday
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park maintained from Lang Rd
  • Kippax Park (EP2) grass car park will not open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am to midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.


Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney Lunar Streets - Haymarket Street Festival

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Lunar Streets Haymarket Festival on Saturday 10 February. The event runs from 5pm to 10pm.

  • Sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Kimber Ln, Little Hay St, Sussex St, Factory St and Little Pier St will be closed from 6am to 12pm on Friday 9 and Monday 12 February, and from 12pm Saturday 10 February to 1am Sunday 11 February.
  • Thomas St will also be closed between Hay St and Ultimo Rd from 2pm Saturday 10 February to 1am Sunday 11 February. 

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Special event clearway parking s will be in effect from 10am Saturday 10 February to 1am Sunday 11 February on sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Little Hay St and Sussex St. A clearway will also be in place on an eastern side section of Thomas St from 1pm Saturday 10 February to 1am Sunday 11 February. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Carr website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:

  • Hay Street* between Sussex Street and Harbour Street
  • Kimber Lane* between Little Hay Street and Hay Street
  • Sussex Street* between Little Hay Street and Hay Street

webLinks.linkText: City of Ryde council - Lunar New Year Eastwood

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 545, 544, 515 and 521 will be diverting from 9.30am -11.30pm while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Lunar New Year Festival at Eastwood Oval from 4pm to 9pm.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions will be in effect, follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

  • West Pde will be closed between Hillview Rd and Wingate Ave from 10am to 11pm.

Motorists will be diverted via local roads, and should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Laneway Festival at Sydney Showground. Start from 11:50am, finish by 11:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park including on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road as ticket holders travel to and from the event. 

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NF - Hope Tour at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts 8:30pm and finishes around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to the show in the busy Friday evening peak. Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v Illawarra Hawks at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip-off from 4pm, full time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park, including on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road as fans travel to and from the match.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Pre-Season Challenge: Rabbitohs v Sea Eagles at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off at 4pm, full time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close at 1pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Newcastle Jets at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full time around 6:55pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game at the same time an event takes place in neighbouring Parramatta Park. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services run regularly. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:25pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to the races.

Please note that traffic may be heavier than usual for attendees leaving the racecourse as P!nk fans travel to nearby Moore Park. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads, and high volumes of taxi and rideshare pick ups and drop offs.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Double Header at Industree Group Stadium. Central Coast Mariners v Melbourne Victory in the women from 5pm, Mariners v Sydney FC in the men at 7:45pm. Finsh by about 9:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run each night. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Taylor Swift | The Eras Tour at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park, Friday - Monday nights. Gates open at 4:30pm, show starts from 6:20pm, finish around 11pm each night.

With 300,000 fans expected over four nights significant traffic delays are expected, particularly on Friday and Monday during the busy evening peaks.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Parking in the precinct is in high demand and is likely to sell out in advance. P1 car park is already sold out for all four shows, with spaces in remaining car parks selling fast.

Fans who need to drive must pre-book parking online to secure a space.

A dedicated pick up and drop off zone will be located in P6 Car park entry via Bennelong Pkway and Murray Rose Ave.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct from Friday to Monday to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

properties.publicTransport: Route 311 buses will be diverting around the closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Darlinghurst Rd. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.


Road closures from 9am to 11:30pm:

  • Darlinghurst Rd between Roslyn St and Macleay St
  • Macleay St between Darlinghurst Rd and Greenknowe Ave.
  • Sections of Orwell St and Hughes St are also closed.
  • Motorists are being detoured via Greenknowe Ave and Macleay St and via Darlinghurst Rd and Roslyn St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Darlinghurst Rd, Elizabeth Bay Rd, Macleay St, Orwell St, Ward Ave and other local roads.


Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Route 389 buses will be diverting around Stanley St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Streets event on Stanley Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Stanley St will be closed between Yurong St and Crown St in both directions from 9am to 11:30pm
  • Sections of Riley St, Yurong St and Chapel St will also be closed during this time
  • Motorists will be detoured via Crown St, William St, College St and Francis St

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Stanley St, Riley St, Yurong St, Crown St and Chapel St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in concert tickets, additional light rail services will run frequently before and after the show. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
P!nk Summer Carnival Tour at Allianz Stadium. Concert starts from 7.30pm Friday and 7pm Saturday, and finishes around 10:30pm/11pm.

With a sold out crowd of more than 35,000 fans, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching Moore Park particularly during the already busy Friday night peak.

Motorists should expect delays and allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. Fans are urged to catch public transport.

Road & Cycleway closures

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4pm each day and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park, EP2 car park and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Please note EP2 parking is very limited due to upgrade works.
  • A pick up and drop off zone will be located on the northern side of Moore Park Rd at Oatley Rd opposite the stadium.
  • The Moore Park Rd/Fitzroy St cycleway will be closed from Poate Rd to Bourke St from 10pm to 12:30am on Friday and from 9:30pm to midnight on Saturday.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm until midnight each day on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice: The annual Love Lanes Festival will be held from 4-9pm on Saturday 10 February in the Town Centre and connecting around 10,000 attendees to Valentine’s Day.
properties.diversions: In addition to the Pacific Highway impact, a number of local roads will be closed from 6am to 11pm: Robleys Lane, Alison Road, Rankens Court, Hely Street, Bakers and Peters Lanes.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade 2024

properties.publicTransport: Buses between the city and the east will be diverting and using different stops from 3pm while major roads are closed. Museum Station will be closed from 5pm until 4am for crowd safety. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Hundreds of thousands of spectators will line the streets to see the Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade travel from Hyde Park to Moore Park via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde from 7:30pm until around 11.30pm.

Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place from as early as 3pm and most roads remain closed until 3am Sunday.

Pedestrian crossing of the parade route on Oxford St and Flinders St will be available until 7pm before the event gets underway, after 7pm there is no pedestrian crossing permitted until roads reopen. 

KEY ROAD CLOSURES

  • From 3pm to midnight: sections of College St, Wentworth Ave and surrounding local streets.
  • From 3pm to 3am: sections of Bourke St, Campbell St and surrounding local streets in Surry Hills.
  • From 4pm to 3am: Flinders St northbound lanes from Moore Park Rd to Oxford St.
  • From 4:30pm to 12.30am: roads between Elizabeth St and Albion St including Reservoir St, Commonwealth St, Campbell St and surrounding local roads. Access will be managed for residents.
  • From 4.30pm to midnight: Liverpool St between Elizabeth St and College St westbound lanes, (eastbound closed until 3am), and local streets in Surry Hills between Elizabeth St and Riley St
  • From 4.30pm to 3am: Oxford St between College St and Darlinghurst Rd, Flinders St southbound from Oxford St, sections of Crown St, sections of South Dowling between Oxford St and Fitzroy St, and southbound Anzac Pde from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd, including the Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde off-ramp (Bondi exit remains open).
  • From 6.30pm to 1am: Moore Park Rd westbound from Oatley Rd to South Dowling St, and Driver Ave between Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd (until 10am Sunday).
  • From 9pm to 11.30pm: sections of Elizabeth St, Castlereagh St and Pitt St between Market St and Goulburn St will close to allow crowds to safely leave the CBD.

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the CBD and Moore Park and to expect delays as traffic will be heavy on detour routes.

Motorists travelling between the city and eastern suburbs will be diverted via Cleveland St in the south or via William St and Darlinghurst Rd in the north.  

Special event clearways will be in effect between 6am Saturday and 3am Sunday on various roads along and surrounding the parade route in the Sydney CBD, Darlinghurst, Surry Hills and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: via Oxford Street, Flinders Street and Anzac Parade

properties.otherAdvice:
Lane closures and parking restrictions will be in place on sections of Flinders St on Friday night to allow for the installation of the parade grandstand ahead of the Mardi Gras Parade on Saturday night. 

Lane closures:

  • From 11pm Fri 1 Mar to 6am Sat 2 Mar - Lanes 1 and 2 northbound on Flinders St between Moore Park Rd and Linden Ln
  • From 6am to 1pm Sat 2 Mar - Lane 1 northbound on Flinders St between Moore Park Rd and Linden Ln
  • From 1pm to 4pm Sat 2 Mar - Lanes 1 and 2 northbound on Flinders St between Moore Park Rd and Oxford St
  • From 4pm Sat 2 Mar until 3am Sun 3 Mar - Flinders St will be fully closed northbound
  • From 4.30pm Sat 2 Mar until 3am Sun 3 Mar - Flinders St will be fully closed southbound.

For full details on parade closures in the city, Darlinghurst and Moore Park from 3pm Sat 2 March see the event entry.

Special event clearways will be in effect on the western side of Flinders St between Moore Park Rd and Oxford St from 10pm Fri 1 Mar to 2am Sun 3 March. Clearways will also be in effect on Short St and Hill St during this time.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.
properties.displayName: Mardi Gras Parade event infrastructure installation

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Bondi Beach party

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run regularly between Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Bondi Beach party will be held near Bondi Pavilion. The event starts from 2pm finishing by 10pm.

With more than 15,000 people expected traffic approaching Bondi Beach will be heavy along Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. Motorists should avoid the area where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time and prepare for delays. 

Local roads and carparks at Bondi Beach will be closed before, during and after the event between 19 Feb and 28 Feb including sections of Queen Elizabeth Dr and Park Drive South. Special event clearways will also be in effect.

  • From 5pm Monday 19 February to 6am Tuesday 27 February: Park Drive South car parking bays 248 to 410 western side will be closed, and Park Drive South car parking bays 294 to 004 eastern side will be closed, and clearway parking restrictions will be in effect.
  • From 3pm Friday 23 February to 6am Sunday 25 February: Queen Elizabeth Drive car parking bays from Campbell Parade roundabout to Bondi Pavilion pedestrian crossing will be closed, and clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on both sides.
  • From 12pm to 11pm on Saturday 24 February: special event clearways will be in effect on sections of Bondi Rd, Campbell Pde, Grafton St and Hall St.
  • From 4pm to 11pm on Saturday 24 February: special event clearways will be in effect on Bondi Rd between Sandridge St and Oxford St southern side only.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Car park closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect around Bondi Beach to support the Bondi Beach Party event on Saturday 24 February. Changed parking arrangements will be in effect before, during and after the event as per the dates and times below.

From 5pm Monday 19 February to 6am Tuesday 27 February:

  • Park Drive South car parking bays 248 to 410 western side will be closed, and clearway parking restrictions will be in effect and Park Drive South car parking bays 294 to 004 eastern side will be closed, and clearway parking restrictions will be in effect.

From 3pm Friday 23 February to 6am Sunday 25 February:

  • Queen Elizabeth Drive car parking bays from Campbell Parade roundabout to Bondi Pavilion pedestrian crossing will be closed, and clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on both sides.

From 12pm to 11pm on Saturday 24 February:

  • Bondi Road Between Sandridge Street and Francis Street eastern side
  • Campbell Parade between Queen Elizabeth Drive (entry) and Queen Elizabeth Drive (exit) eastern side
  • Campbell Parade median parking between Beach Road and Wairoa Avenue (8 parking spaces opposite Bondi Beach Public School) centre median
  • Campbell Parade between Brighton Boulevard and Hastings Parade (North Bondi Bus Interchange) both sides / centre median
  • Campbell Parade between Notts Avenue and Queen Elizabeth Drive eastern side
  • Campbell Parade between Sir Thomas Mitchell Road and Lamrock Avenue western side
  • Grafton Street between Grosvenor Street and Newland Street
  • Hall Street between Gould Lane and Campbell Parade (Accessible Drop Off and Pick Up Zone) northern side

From 4pm to 11pm on Saturday 24 February:

  • Bondi Road between Sandridge Street and Oxford Street southern side only.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures and Special Event Clearways

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Melbourne Victory at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off from 6pm, finish around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Brisbane Bullets. Tip-off at 5:30pm, full time around 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads including Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Local roads around the stadium may close to help crowds move safely around the area.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists are advised to allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: Willoughby City Council - Lunar New Year Chatswood

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 115, 120, 267 and 275 will be diverting around Victoria Ave from 4pm to 9pm. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info
properties.otherAdvice:
Lunar New Year festivities including a twilight lantern parade will be held along Victoria Ave in Chatswood. The Lantern parade will start from Chatswood Place on Hercules St, the parade will walk through Victoria Ave, passing Chatswood Chase and the stalls, finishing at Anderson St on the side of The Concourse.

Road closures will be in place between 4pm and 9pm.

Road closures from 4pm to 9pm for the event:

  • Victoria Ave, closed from Anderson St to Archer St
  • Anderson St, closed from Help St to Victoria Ave
  • Ferguson Ln, closed from Anderson St to The Concourse Car Park

Road closures from 6pm to 8pm during the parade:

  • Hercules St and Oscar St half closure to Chatswood Place car park
  • Victoria Ave between Hercules St and Archer St
  • Archer St between Albert Ave and Malvern Ave
  • Bertram St from Victoria Ave to Albert Ave
  • Neridah St from Victoria Ave to Albert Ave
  • Kirk St and Mills Ln

Motorists will be detoured via local roads. Traffic will be heavy so allow plenty of extra travel time.

Exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads in the area.
properties.displayName: Lunar New Year Festival and Parade

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Women: Sydney FC v Perth Glory at Leichhardt Oval. Kick-off from 7pm and full time around 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to the match.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place.

Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: Hurstville Lunar New Year - Georges River Council

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 410, 452, 455, 490, 491 and 947 will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend Lunar New Year celebrations along Forest Rd in Hurstville from 4pm to 10pm.

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time as traffic will be heavier than usual on roads in the area including King Georges Rd, Queens Rd and Railway Pde during the event. 

  • From 6am to midnight Forest Rd will be closed between Queens Road and Treacy St. Surrounding local roads may also be closed

Bus zones will be extended, check signs carefully as no parking is permitted in a signposted bus zone.

The Bay to Bridge running festival is a one-day event consisting of four distances. Runners will start and head over the bridge to a turn point on Wharf Rd, returning to another turn point along Beach Rd at Corrigans Beach Reserve.

Wharf Street will be closed at the Princes Highway Southbound off-ramp for the duration of the event.

Motorists are advised to take caution in the area with increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport:
Buses to and from the city will be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed.

L2 & L3 Light Rail services will also be impacted.

Check transportnsw.info/alerts for the latest info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place between 2:15pm and 4:00pm approximately for a Police Operation planned protest march.

  • St James Rd between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St
  • Elizabeth St between Hunter St and Park St southbound
  • Elizabeth St between Park St and King St northbound
  • Castlereagh St between King St and Market St
  • Market St between Elizabeth St and Clarence St eastbound
  • Market St between Clarence St and York St westbound
  • Park St between Castlereagh St and George St
  • Druitt St between George St and Kent St
  • York St between King St and Druitt St
  • Pitt St between Bathurst St and Market St
  • Clarence St between Druitt St and Market St

Motorists should avoid the area during this time or expect delays and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

roads.mainStreet: Market Street, Clarence Street, Druitt Street, Park Street, Pitt Street and Elizabeth Street

properties.otherAdvice:
The Expo will be held from 9am on Friday 2 February to 4pm on Sunday 4 February at Newcastle Entertainment Centre and Showground featuring the latest in caravans, motorhomes, campervans, camper trailers, accessories and holiday parks.

There is no vehicle access to Newcastle Showground from Griffiths Rd. Both the westbound left-turn and eastbound right-turn lanes are closed.

The Peter Wilson Memorial Touch Gala day will be taking place at Tomaree Sports Complex on Saturday 3 and Sunday 4 February from 6am until 7pm each day. Nelson Bay Road approaching the event site will be busier than usual as attendees and spectators travel to and from the event. The right hand turn lane from Nelson Bay Rd into the venue will be restricted during the event. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.
properties.displayName: Peter Wilson Memorial Touch Football Gala Day

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 5pm, full time approx 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive
